title: My learning history narrative worksheet
summary: Helps learners unpack their story with computing and write alternative narratives.
example_1_text: The first time I remember using a computer was...
example_2_text: If I told my story as 'I'm learning to code' instead of 'I'm bad at code', it would sound like...

title: Post-session reflection prompts
summary: Guides learners to review what they tried, what happened, and what to adjust next time.
example_2_text: Next time I'll change one thing in how I work, which is...

title: Group agreements for supportive labs
summary: Shared norms that reduce fear of embarrassment and make asking for help routine.
example_1_text: We treat bugs and errors as normal, not as signs someone doesn't belong.
example_2_text: It's OK to say 'I'm stuck' within 5 minutes of trying on your own.

title: Question-asking scripts
summary: Sentence stems for asking clear, shame-free questions about code and concepts.
example_1_text: I'm working on [brief task] in [language/tool]. I expected it to... but instead it...
example_2_text: Right now I'd like: a small hint / a bigger explanation / a code example.

title: Self-compassion and inner-critic dialogue sheet
summary: Balances the 'I cannot do this' belief with kinder counter-statements.
example_1_text: You're terrible at this. Everyone else gets it.
example_2_text: Tests are supposed to catch issues. You're learning like everyone else. What's one tiny piece to improve first?

title: Micro-practices cheat sheet for instructors
summary: Low-effort phrases and moves that normalise bugs and make errors feel safe.
example_1_text: If you have zero error messages today, you're either a genius or you didn't run your code.
example_2_text: After asking a question, silently count to 3 before jumping in; say 'I'll give folks a few seconds to think.'

title: Peer-observation rubric
summary: Structured prompts for observing teaching moves that reduce anxiety.
example_1_text: Instructor explicitly frames errors/bugs as normal parts of learning.
example_2_text: Structures like 'Ask 3 then me' or a buddy system are visible and encouraged.

title: When I'm Stuck flowchart
summary: Step-by-step plan for the first minutes when code will not run.
example_1_text: Typos, missing imports/packages, wrong file saved/run, mismatched brackets/indent.
example_2_text: Add a print/log or run just a tiny part of the code to see what changes.

title: Pre-session check-in cards
summary: Prompts to surface worries before coding and decide how to respond.
example_2_text: A slower pace / more examples / a buddy / reassurance it's OK to ask 'basic' questions.

title: Feedback practices guide
summary: Helps teachers give strategy-focused feedback instead of reinforcing labels.
example_1_text: I can see you're trying X strategy here â€“ that's a strong choice because...
example_2_text: I'm giving you these comments because I have high expectations and I'm confident you can reach them.

title: Personal anxiety-pattern map
summary: Maps how situations, thoughts, and feelings link so patterns can be managed.
example_1_text: Pair programming starts -> 'Everyone will see I don't belong here.'
example_2_text: Most people focus on their own code; ask one clarification question and run the code anyway.

title: Trait-aware learning journals template
summary: Regular prompts to track progress and reduce social comparison anxiety.
example_1_text: A moment I compared myself to others was... The story I told myself was... A more realistic story is...
example_2_text: One tiny change I'll test in how I study or practice is...

title: Values and motivation sheet
summary: Anchors low confidence to personally meaningful reasons for learning to code.
example_1_text: Value: Curiosity; Coding connects because it lets me take things apart and rebuild them; Tiny action: explore one 'what if' for 10 minutes.
example_2_text: Value: Helping others; Coding connects because I can write tools that make jobs easier; Tiny action: ask a peer what small tool might help them.
